conversationHistory.userMessage: How should I store leftover dal?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you with storing leftover dal to reduce waste.

• Allow the dal to cool completely before refrigerating. Store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Properly stored, dal can last for 3-4 days.

• To freeze dal, portion it into freezer-safe containers or bags. Frozen dal can maintain its quality for about 2-3 months. Thaw it in the refrigerator before reheating.

• Consider making dal paratha from leftover dal. Mix the dal with wheat flour, spices, and a little oil to form a dough. Roll out parathas and cook them on a tawa. (Estimated cost: 40 BDT)

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions from landfills.

Next step: Refrigerate your dal in an airtight container as soon as it cools down.
